claims.claim: Heritage Trench Coats achieve 100% organic cotton sourcing at heritage manufacturing sites
claims.quote: As of 2024, we're proud to say that the gabardine fabric used for our Heritage Trench Coats is woven from 100 per cent organically grown cotton** at our heritage manufacturing sites in Yorkshire, England.

claims.claim: Manufacturing sites operate on 100% renewable electricity
claims.quote: At our manufacturing sites in Castleford and Keighley, which both run on 100 per cent renewable electricity, it takes a year for each specialist tailor to master the stitching of the intricate trench coat collar.

claims.claim: Organic cotton provides water and chemical intensity reduction compared to conventional cotton
claims.quote: Organic cotton** is a less chemical and water-intensive alternative to conventionally produced cotton.

claims.claim: Buttons achieve 90% bio-based renewable material composition
claims.quote: The buttons on these styles are also made from 90 per cent bio-based resin, which is a renewable natural resource derived from plants.

claims.claim: Burberry's sustainability bond achieved 8x oversubscription demonstrating strong investor demand
claims.quote: There was more than eight times the volume of orders than paper available, says Brown.

claims.claim: Burberry increased Scope 3 emissions reduction target from 30% to 46% by 2030
claims.quote: On top of making major Scope 1 and 2 carbon cuts, the company had aimed for a 30% reduction of Scope 3 emissions by 2030 but has raised target to 46%.

claims.claim: Long-standing supplier relationships facilitate easier achievement of Scope 3 targets
claims.quote: Long-standing relationships with its suppliers have made achieving the Scope 3 target easier, says Burberry CFO Julie Brown.

claims.claim: Burberry's brand value nearly quadrupled under CEO Angela Ahrendts' sustainability-focused leadership
claims.quote: During her tenure, Burberry's value nearly quadrupled.

claims.claim: Burberry destroyed $40M worth of merchandise in 2017, equivalent to over 20,000 signature trench coats
claims.quote: Recently, the brand's annual earnings report revealed that Burberry incinerated nearly $40M worth of merchandise in 2017. The Times points out, 'Even at [Burberry]'s notoriously high prices, that is the equivalent of more than 20,000 of its signature trench coats.'

claims.claim: Waste merchandise value doubled over two years and increased six times since 2013
claims.quote: The value of wasted merchandise has doubled over the last two years and increased by six times since 2013.

claims.claim: Burberry's £300m sustainability bond was 7.9 times oversubscribed enabling tight pricing at 1.125% coupon
claims.quote: With the bond being 7.9 times oversubscribed, the company was able to achieve what it describes as 'tight pricing', with the paper paying a coupon of 1.125%.

claims.claim: Burberry committed to 95% reduction in direct greenhouse gas emissions below 2016 levels by 2022
claims.quote: Among other targets, it has committed to reduce its direct greenhouse gas emissions, and those associated with the energy it buys, to 95% below 2016 levels by 2022.
